Why must agents gather information from: To precisely understand and fulfill the user's exact intent
Why does SWEET-RL break down DPO learnin: User-agent multi-turn interactions exhibit high variance, making it difficult to determine if specific utterances were appropriate
Why do agent utterances that commonly oc: The model learns to distinguish actions by their relative frequency in positive vs negative trajectories
What metric is used to evaluate the Back: % Tests Passed and Success Rate (unit tests)
What metric is used to evaluate the Fron: Cosine Similarity and Win Rate against GPT-4o
The 'Unavailable Service' non-collaborat: Customers with illegitimate complaints and unavailable service requests
Why might a 'Tangential' user become fru: If the agent does not reply to their tangential utterances
In the Incomplete Utterance simulation,: Using real-world incomplete utterances as few-shot examples and truncating generated utterances
What is the role of the Dialogue State T: Ensures the user provides all information specified in the user goal during conversation
What is the role of the Ending Verifier: Prevents premature termination of the conversation
What four criteria are used to evaluate: Personal Preference, Frequency, Timing, and Communication & Safety
Why do some personas in ProPerSim show p: Their preferences require fact-based and critical thinking with context-dependent timing and frequency
What does S(a) consist of in the ProPerS: (A, R) pairs - action and recommendation pairs
